action.name: Alchemical Potion
entries: The alchemist applies a potion to it self or a creature within 5 feet. The potion creates the effect of a spell, affecting the creature it was applied to instead of its normal targets. If the spell would ordinarily require {@status Concentration|XPHB}, it loses the {@status Concentration|XPHB} requirement and instead lasts for its full duration.
The alchemist has prepared potions that can create the following spell effects, using Intelligence as the spell casting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

Alchemists brew potions that distill magic into bottled form. Using exotic ingredients or experimentation in new sciences, they create bottles of liquid flame, potions that heal wounds, and concoctions that enhance the body. The ingredients and knowledge each alchemist uses vary greatly, but all alchemists' work seems strange and esoteric to the rest of the world.

trait.name: Alchemical Immortality
entries: The alchemist cannot die, does not age, and regains 20 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. If its body is destroyed, it reforms the next round in an unoccupied space nearest to its previous location.

In order to maintain this trait, the alchemist must consume a unique potion that it creates each day by spending an hour in uninterrupted work using alchemist's supplies. If the alchemist is prevented from consuming its potion for more than 24 hours, the effects of the potion cease. If any creature other than the alchemist drinks the potion, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or die instantly.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The archer makes two Longbow attacks.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Deadly Aim
entries: The archer targets a creature or object it can see. The archer's ranged attacks against the target have Advantage and deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) damage. This effect ends if the archer moves 5 feet or more, if it attacks another target, or if it uses this ability again.

Striking a target at range can determine survival in the wilderness or success on the battlefield, and none strike more swiftly or more surely than an archer. Archers use ranged weapons—usually bows—to take down enemies before those enemies can escape or retaliate. Given a moment to aim, they can land devastating shots against heavily armored targets and fire precisely over extreme distances. Enemies hoping to overcome an archer must either match their ranged abilities or learn the hard way why those abilities are so valued on the battlefield.

entries: The archer targets a creature or object it can see. The archer's ranged attacks against the target have Advantage and deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage. This effect ends if the archer moves 5 feet or more, if it attacks another target, or if it uses this ability again.

bonus.name: Crippling Shot
entries: Immediately after the archer hits a target with a Longbow attack—{@actSave str} {@dc 18}, the target of the attack. {@actSaveFail} The archer chooses one of the following:

items.entry: The target's Speed is halved until the beginning of the archer's next turn.
The target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition if it is Large or smaller.
The target deals half damage with melee attacks until the end of its next turn.

entries: Striking a target at range can determine survival in the wilderness or success on the battlefield, and none strike more swiftly or more surely than an archer. Archers use ranged weapons—usually bows—to take down enemies before those enemies can escape or retaliate. Given a moment to aim, they can land devastating shots against heavily armored targets and fire precisely over extreme distances. Enemies hoping to overcome an archer must either match their ranged abilities or learn the hard way why those abilities are so valued on the battlefield.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The assassin makes two Dagger attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Assassin's Mark
entries: The assassin targets a creature it can see. Its attacks against the target have Advantage. The first attack the assassin scores against the target deals an extra 5 damage if the target has not taken a turn in combat. The assassin loses these benefits after one minute, or if it targets another creature with this ability.

bonus.name: Exit Strategy
entries: The assassin takes the Disengage action.
Assassins are trained to study their mark, approach without notice, and deliver a killing stroke before making their escape. Their abilities are focused on reconnaissance, stealth, and making

a single deadly attack. Assassins prefer to avoid prolonged combat, and often retreat if an assassination attempt starts to turn into an all-out brawl. If forced to fight, assassins use their deadly skills to finish the job or carve a path out.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) Piercing damage. The attack instead deals 25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) Piercing damage if the assassin has Advantage on the attack roll or if the target is within 5 feet of one of the assassin's allies.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +7} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) Piercing damage. The attack instead deals 31 ({@damage 6d8 + 4}) Piercing damage if the assassin has Advantage on the attack roll or if the target is within 5 feet of one of the assassin's allies.

action.name: Assassin's Mark
entries: The assassin targets a creature it can see. Its attacks against the target have Advantage. The first attack the assassin scores against the target deals an extra 15 damage if the target has not taken a turn in combat. The assassin loses these benefits after one minute, or if it targets another creature with this ability.

bonus.name: Exit Strategy
entries: The assassin takes the Disengage action.
Assassins are trained to study their mark, approach without notice, and deliver a killing stroke before making their escape. Their abilities are focused on reconnaissance, stealth, and making

a single deadly attack. Assassins prefer to avoid prolonged combat, and often retreat if an assassination attempt starts to turn into an all-out brawl. If forced to fight, assassins use their deadly skills to finish the job or carve a path out.

trait.name: Furious
entries: At the start of its turn, the berserker can enter a fury until the start of its next turn. While in a fury, the berserker gains Advantage on all melee attack rolls, but attack rolls against it have Advantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The berserker makes two Battleaxe attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Handaxe
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Slashing damage.

Berserkers are ferocious warriors who are not afraid to take a blow. Some revel in the glory of battle, while others disregard their own safety for a cause they feel is greater than themselves. Berserkers become more deadly when wounded, whether because their bloodlust has been stoked or because they become even more desperate to win. Their battle-fury makes them difficult to control or intimidate, and once unleashed, a berserker will fight to their last breath.

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) Slashing damage.

bonus.name: Underhanded Hex (Recharge after a Short or Long  Rest)
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 11}, one creature the blackguard can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} Until the start of the blackguard's next turn, the target's Speed is reduced to 0 and the blackguard has Advantage on attack rolls against it.

Blackguards are profane warriors, harbingers of destruction and dread. They wield tainted steel and sorcery in the pursuit of dark goals or in service to malevolent gods. Fear is a favorite weapon of the blackguard, and their magic cripples or corrupts their adversaries in battle. Because of their vile tactics, blackguards often stand in opposition to paladins or similar heroes. Their subversive spells, devastating attacks, and overpowering presence make them formidable leaders for the forces of evil.

entries: When a hostile creature within 10 feet of the blackguard makes an attack roll or a saving throw, the creature must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw. Creatures that are immune to the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition are immune to this trait.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blackguard makes two Greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) Slashing damage plus 24 ({@damage 7d6}) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Malediction's Strike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 10}, reach 5 ft. {@h}43 ({@damage 11d6 + 5}) Necrotic damage, and the target gains Vulnerability to all damage until the end of the blackguard's next turn.

bonus.name: Underhanded Hex {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 17}, one creature the blackguard can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} Until the start of the blackguard's next turn, the target's Speed is reduced to 0 and the blackguard has Advantage on attack rolls against it.

Blackguards are profane warriors, harbingers of destruction and dread. They wield tainted steel and sorcery in the pursuit of dark goals or in service to malevolent gods. Fear is a favorite weapon of the blackguard, and their magic cripples or corrupts their adversaries in battle. Because of their vile tactics, blackguards often stand in opposition to paladins or similar heroes. Their subversive spells, devastating attacks, and overpowering presence make them formidable leaders for the forces of evil.

action.name: Elegant Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Piercing or Slashing damage (blademaster's choice).

reaction.name: Parry
entries: {@actTrigger} The blademaster is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. {@actResponse} The blademaster adds 2 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss. If the attack misses, the blademaster can immediately use Riposte as part of the same Reaction.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: Trigger: A creature the blademaster can see misses it with a melee attack. Response: The blademaster makes an Elegant Blade attack against the creature.

Blademasters are martial experts who flow through battle with precision and grace, employing extraordinary techniques with their weapon of choice. Some blademasters express their talents in a showy, elaborate fighting style, and others in more subtle, efficient movements. Most blademasters attain their skill through diligent study and training, but some are prodigies who rely on keen instincts and adaptation. Whatever their style, blademasters elevate combat to a form that approaches art.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blademaster makes three Elegant Blade attacks.

action.name: Elegant Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) Piercing or Slashing damage (blademaster's choice).

action.name: Blademaster's Technique {@recharge 4}
entries: The blademaster uses one of the following options:

items: {@b Swift Assault.} The blademaster moves up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks. It can make one Elegant Blade attack against each creature that it can reach during this movement.

{@b Disarming Series.} The blademaster makes two Elegant Blade attacks, then chooses a creature hit by one of the attacks. The target drops an item of the blademaster's choice that it is holding. The blademaster can fling the item up to 20 feet in any direction.
{@b Master Stroke.} The blademaster makes an Elegant Blade attack with Advantage. If the attack hits, it deals an extra 22 ({@damage 4d10}) damage and ignores Resistances.

action.name: Perfected Technique {@recharge 4}
entries: The blademaster uses one of the following options:

items: {@b Step Between Winds.} The blademaster targets any number of creatures within 30 feet, then teleports to each target and makes one Elegant Blade attack against it. The blademaster can then teleport to an unoccupied space within 30 feet of its original position.

{@b Blade of Air.} The blademaster makes an Elegant Blade attack with a reach of 50 feet. The attack is made with Advantage, deals an extra 32 ({@damage 5d12}) damage if it hits, and ignores Resistances.

Whatever their style, blademasters elevate combat to a form that approaches art.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The blademaster makes three Elegant Blade attacks.

action.name: Elegant Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) Piercing or Slashing damage (blademaster's choice).

action.name: Blademaster's Technique {@recharge 4}
entries: The blademaster uses one of the following options:

items: {@b Swift Assault.} The blademaster moves up to its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks. It can make one Elegant Blade attack against each creature that it can reach during this movement.

{@b Disarming Series.} The blademaster makes two Elegant Blade attacks, then chooses a creature hit by one of the attacks. The target drops an item of the blademaster's choice that it is holding. The blademaster can fling the item up to 20 feet in any direction.
{@b Master Stroke.} The blademaster makes an Elegant Blade attack with Advantage. If the attack hits, it deals an extra 13 ({@damage 3d8}) damage and ignores Resistances.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: {@actTrigger} The blademaster is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. {@actResponse} The blademaster adds 3 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss. If the attack misses, the blademaster can immediately use Riposte as part of the same Reaction.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature the blademaster can see misses it with a melee attack. {@actResponse} The blademaster makes an Elegant Blade attack against the creature.

trait.name: Ward
entries: The bodyguard is dedicated to the protection of another creature, called its ward. This has the following effects:

items.name: Defensive Positioning
items.entry: As long as the bodyguard is within 5 feet of its ward and is not {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, attacks against the ward have Disadvantage, and the ward has Advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

items.name: Coordinated Initiative
items.entry: After Initiative is rolled, the bodyguard may choose to ignore its Initiative roll and instead act immediately after its ward in Initiative.

entries: The bodyguard can spend 1 minute committing itself to the protection of a new ward, at which point the former ward's protection ends.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bodyguard makes two Mace attacks.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Intercept
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature within 5 feet is hit by an attack. The bodyguard must see the attacker. {@actResponse} The bodyguard causes itself to be hit instead.

Bodyguards are disciplined warriors trained to put another person's safety above their own. Shield in hand, they deflect blows or put themselves in front of attacks meant to harm their ward. Bodyguards' selfless service usually requires a deep sense of devotion to their ward, but sometimes enough gold can buy their loyalty. Outside of combat, bodyguards are tasked with perceiving and circumventing dangers to their ward. They remain uncannily alert and vigilant when on duty, ever ready to stand as the last line of defense for the ones they protect.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

entries: The bodyguard cannot be {@status surprised|XPHB}.

items.name: Defensive Positioning
items.entry: As long as the bodyguard is within 5 feet of its ward and is not {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}, attacks against the ward have Disadvantage, and the ward has Advantage on Dexterity saving throws.

items.name: Coordinated Initiative

entries: The bodyguard can spend 1 minute committing itself to the protection of a new ward, at which point the former ward's protection ends.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bodyguard makes two Morningstar attacks. It can replace one attack with a Shield Bash attack.

action.name: Morningstar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 7d6 + 4}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition if it is Medium or smaller.

reaction.name: Tireless Protector
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature within 5 feet is hit by an attack or makes a saving throw against a spell with no other targets. {@actResponse} If the creature was hit by an attack, the attack hits the bodyguard instead. If the creature was the target of a spell, the bodyguard magically switches the target of the spell to itself and automatically fails its first saving throw against the spell.
If the bodyguard uses this ability to protect its ward, the bodyguard's Reaction is not consumed.

resist.special: All except Psychic or damage from Critical Hits

trait.name: Weak Spot
entries: When a creature scores a Critical Hit against the brute, the brute has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the start of that creature's next turn.

trait.name: Moment of Weakness
entries: While the brute is {@condition Stunned|XPHB}, it loses all Resistances.

action.name: Grab
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 Bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it has the Grappled condition (escape DC 13). The brute can have one target Grappled at a time.

action.name: Crush
entries: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, a creature Grappled by the brute. Failure: 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Bludgeoning damage. Success: Half damage.

Brutes are stoic bruisers who take hit after hit, shrugging off damage as they get close enough to crush their foes into submission. Not known for subtlety, brutes approach their target directly, trudging through treacherous terrain, other combatants, and sometimes even walls. Brutes are not entirely impervious to harm, however, and most have a weak spot that can be exploited to bring them down. While the brute's straightforward approach to combat may lead enemies to dismiss them, opponents should exercise caution: If the brute's hands ever close on them, it's lights out.

resist.special: All except Psychic or damage from Critical Hits

trait.name: Weak Spot
entries: When a creature scores a Critical Hit against the brute, the brute has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the start of that creature's next turn.

trait.name: Moment of Weakness
entries: While the brute is {@condition Stunned|XPHB}, it loses all Resistances.

action.name: Fist
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 5}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 Bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Strategist
entries: The captain and its allies within 30 feet have Advantage on Initiative rolls.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Battlefield Command
entries: Up to two allies within 60 feet can make an attack using their Reaction, if available. To use this ability, the captain and its allies must be able to see or hear each other.

Captains are battlefield leaders who direct their allies in combat. They use calculated tactics and inspiring confidence to orchestrate battles, guiding their companions to strike at the perfect moment or position themselves to halt enemy advance. Captains are also capable warriors in their own right, and are unafraid to lead from the front lines when it is called for. Under the guidance of a captain, even an unassuming group of fighters is a formidable force greater than the sum of its parts.

action.name: Rally
entries: The captain targets any number of creatures it can see within 60 feet. Any effects on the targets that cause the Charmed or Frightened conditions are removed. The targets can then move up to their speed using their Reaction, if available. This movement does not provoke Opportunity Attacks. To use this ability, the captain and its allies must be able to see or hear each other.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Battlefield Command
entries: Up to two allies within 60 feet can make an attack using their Reaction, if available. To use this ability, the captain and its allies must be able to see or hear each other.

action.name: Rally
entries: The captain targets any number of creatures it can see within 60 feet. Any effects on the targets that cause the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions are removed. The targets can then move up to their speed using their Reaction, if available. This movement does not provoke Opportunity Attacks. To use this ability, the captain and its allies must be able to see or hear each other.

action.name: Demoralise
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 17}, each enemy within 60 feet that can see or hear the commander, and that hasn't been targeted by this ability in the last 24 hours. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Evasive Maneuvers
entries: Trigger: The captain or any number of its allies it can see within 60 feet become the target of an effect that requires a saving throw. Response: The captain uses its Rally ability. Any creatures who are no longer a valid target for the effect (for example, an ally who leaves the affected area of a Fireball spell) are unaffected by it. If the captain or any of the creatures must still make a saving throw, they add +5 to the roll.

Captains are battlefield leaders who direct their allies in combat. They use calculated tactics and inspiring confidence to orchestrate battles, guiding their companions to strike at the perfect moment or position themselves to halt enemy advance. Captains are also capable warriors in their own right, and are unafraid to lead from the front lines when it is called for. Under the guidance of a captain, even an unassuming group of fighters is a formidable force greater than the sum of its parts.

trait.name: Traps
entries: The commando can create a trap by spending 10 minutes assembling and hiding it at a point on an adjacent surface. The first time a creature other than the commando moves within 5 feet of the trap, it activates.

items.name: Immobilizing Trap
items.entry: {@actSave dex} {@dc 11}, each creature within 5 feet of the trap when it activates. {@actSaveFail} The target's Speed is reduced to 0 until the trapped creature or a creature adjacent to it uses an action to end the effect by making a successful {@dc 11} Strength (Athletics) check.

items.name: Wounding Trap
items.entry: {@actSave dex} {@dc 11}, each creature within 10 feet of the trap when it activates. {@actSaveFail} 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Piercing damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

entries: A hidden trap can be perceived with a {@dc 11} Wisdom (Perception) check, and safely disarmed with a {@dc 11} Intelligence (Arcana) check or a {@dc 11} Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The commando makes two Shortsword or Longbow attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Rapid Deployment (3/Day)
entries: The commando creates one of its Traps, and then throws the trap up to 30 feet. The trap immediately activates where it lands.

Commandos are specialists trained to employ a variety of traps and tools to gain an edge over their opponents. Their equipment makes the battlefield a hazardous place for their enemies, and they have the tactical acumen to turn the tables even when outnumbered. With skills in stealth and tracking, as well as both melee and ranged combat, commandos are as capable alone as they are in groups, and the versatility of their traps makes them deadly whether they are hunter or hunted.

entries: The commando can create a trap by spending 10 minutes assembling and hiding it at a point on an adjacent surface. The first time a creature other than the commando moves within 5 feet of the trap, it activates.

items.name: Choking Trap
items.entry: When this trap activates, it releases poison gas in a 15-foot-radius Sphere. The Sphere is Lightly Obscured. The gas lingers for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong wind. {@actSave con} {@dc 16}, any creature within the gas's area when the trap activates, or any creature that ends its turn in the gas. {@actSaveFail} The target gains the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} in this way, the target cannot concentrate on spells.

items.name: Dazing Trap
items.entry: {@actSave con} {@dc 16}, each creature within 10 feet of the trap when it activates. {@actSaveFail} The target gains the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Deafened|XPHB} conditions for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save with Advantage at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

items.name: Blasting Trap

items.entry: {@actSave str} {@dc 17}, each creature within 5 feet of the trap when it activates. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the trapped creature or a creature adjacent to it uses an action to end the effect by making a successful {@dc 17} Strength (Athletics) check.

items.name: Spell Trap
items.entry: When this trap activates, it creates a 15-foot radius Sphere that suppresses spells of 4th level or lower. Affected spells cannot be cast within the Sphere and cannot target anything inside the Sphere. Any part of an affected spell's area that overlaps with the Sphere is suppressed. Affected spells on a creature or object are suppressed while the creature or object is in the Sphere. The Sphere disappears after one minute.

Commandos are specialists trained to employ a variety of traps and tools to gain an edge over their opponents. Their equipment makes the battlefield a hazardous place for their enemies, and they have the tactical acumen to turn the tables even when outnumbered. With skills in stealth and tracking, as well as both melee and ranged combat, commandos are as capable alone as they are in groups, and the versatility of their traps makes them deadly whether they are hunter or hunted.

trait.name: Traps
entries: The commando can create a trap by spending 10 minutes assembling and hiding it at a point on an adjacent surface. The first time a creature other than the commando moves within 5 feet of the trap, it activates.

items.name: Immobilizing Trap
items.entry: {@actSave dex} {@dc 12}, each creature within 5 feet of the trap when it activates. {@actSaveFail} The target's Speed is reduced to 0 until the trapped creature or a creature adjacent to it uses an action to end the effect by making a successful {@dc 12} Strength (Athletics) check.

items.name: Wounding Trap
items.entry: {@actSave dex} {@dc 11}, each creature within 10 feet of the trap when it activates. {@actSaveFail} 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Piercing damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

entries: A hidden trap can be perceived with a {@dc 12} Wisdom (Perception) check, and safely disarmed with a {@dc 12} Intelligence (Arcana) check or a {@dc 12} Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The commando makes two Shortsword or Longbow attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Rapid Deployment (3/Day)
entries: The commando creates one of its Traps, and then throws the trap up to 30 feet. The trap immediately activates where it lands.

trait.name: Magical Traps
entries: The commando can create a trap by spending 10 minutes assembling and hiding it at a point on an adjacent surface. The first time a creature other than the commando moves within 5 feet of the trap, it activates.

items.name: Blasting Trap
items.entry: {@actSave dex} {@dc 19}, each creature within 10 feet of the trap when it activates. {@actSaveFail} 45 ({@damage 13d6}) Force damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

items.name: Fettering Trap
items.entry: {@actSave str} {@dc 19}, each creature within 5 feet of the trap when it activates. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the trapped creature or a creature adjacent to it uses an action to end the effect by making a successful {@dc 19} Strength (Athletics) check.

items.name: Spell Trap
items.entry: When this trap activates, it creates a 15-foot radius Sphere that suppresses spells of 5th level or lower. Affected spells cannot be cast within the Sphere and cannot target anything inside the Sphere. Any part of an affected spell's area that overlaps with the Sphere is suppressed. Affected spells on a creature or object are suppressed while the creature or object is in the Sphere. The Sphere disappears after one minute.

items.name: Sunburst Trap
items.entry: {@actSave con} {@dc 19}, each creature within 10 feet of the trap when it activates. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries: A hidden trap can be perceived with a {@dc 19} Wisdom (Perception) check, and safely disarmed with a {@dc 19} Intelligence (Arcana) check or a {@dc 19} Dexterity (Thieves' Tools) check.

Guards are employed to keep places or people secure. They enforce the law, keep intruders out of restricted areas, and intervene when someone threatens the peace. Guards are often seen posted at gates or patrolling the streets, where they keep an eye out for anything out of place. While novice guards can be evaded with distractions or stealth, veterans are implacable sentries who foil attempts to slip past them or escape retribution. Generally, guards are lookouts more than they are soldiers, but a determined guard should not be dismissed in a fight.

trait.name: Shrewd Observer
entries: The guard has Advantage on checks made as part of the Search action.

trait.name: Spell Sense
entries: The guard can detect the direction of and distance to active spells within 100 feet that have a duration longer than instantaneous. This trait doesn't allow the guard to discern any other information about the spell, such as its school or function.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guard makes three Spear Attacks.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 5d10 + 1}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Defensive Stand
entries: The guard braces itself against enemy advance until the beginning of its next turn. While the guard is braced, it can make an Opportunity Attack against any creature that enters its reach for the first time on a turn. In addition, it can take up to three Reactions per round but no more than one per turn.

entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 17}, any creature that attempts to use teleportation or planar travel to enter or exit a space within 100 feet of the guard. {@actSaveFail} The guard is aware of the attempt and can change the destination of the creature to an unoccupied space adjacent to the guard, instead of the creature's intended destination.

entries: {@actTrigger} The guard sees a creature cast a spell that targets the guard or includes the guard in the spell's area. {@actResponse} The guard magically draws the spell into its shield, then reflects it. Instead of the spell's original target and area, the guard reselects the targets and area as if the spell had been cast from the guard's space, using the original caster's spell slot level, spell save DC, attack bonus, and spellcasting ability.

entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 19}, any creature that attempts to use teleportation or planar travel to enter or exit a space within 100 feet of the guard. {@actSaveFail} The guard is aware of the attempt and can change the destination of the creature to an unoccupied space adjacent to the guard, instead of the creature's intended destination.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guard makes three Spear Attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +12} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}37 ({@damage 7d8 + 6}) Piercing damage. If this attack is an Opportunity Attack, the target's Speed is reduced to 0 until the end of the turn.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +8} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}54 ({@damage 8d12 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Defensive Stand
entries: The guard braces itself against enemy advance until the beginning of its next turn. While the guard is braced, it can make an Opportunity Attack against any creature that enters its reach for the first time on a turn. In addition, it can take up to three Reactions per round but no more than one per turn.

reaction.name: Spell Reflection (3/Day)
entries: {@actTrigger} The guard sees a creature cast a spell that targets the guard or includes the guard in the spell's area. {@actResponse} The guard magically draws the spell into its shield, then reflects it. Instead of the spell's original target and area, the guard reselects the targets and area as if the spell had been cast from the guard's space, using the original caster's spell slot level, spell save DC, attack bonus, and spellcasting ability.

Guards are employed to keep places or people secure. They enforce the law, keep intruders out of restricted areas, and intervene when someone threatens the peace. Guards are often seen posted at gates or patrolling the streets, where they keep an eye out for anything out of place. While novice guards can be evaded with distractions or stealth, veterans are implacable sentries who foil attempts to slip past them or escape retribution. Generally, guards are lookouts more than they are soldiers, but a determined guard should not be dismissed in a fight.

trait.name: Magical Devices
entries: The inventor has assembled up to three devices that it can use to create magical effects. Each device is an object no larger than Huge. Tiny devices can be wielded in one hand by the inventor or attached to a willing Construct. The inventor can control and create effects from devices within 100 feet.
Regardless of size, each device has 10 Hit Points, an AC of 14, and immunity to Poison and Psychic damage. The inventor can make a new device by spending one hour with a set of tools.

action.name: Lightning Lance
entries: One of the inventor's Magical Devices fires lightning. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 12, each creature in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line. Failure: 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Lightning damage.

action.name: Concussive Pulse
entries: One of the inventor's Magical Devices emits disruptive sound. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 12, each creature in a 15-foot Cone. Failure: 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Thunder damage, the target loses Concentration, and on the target's next turn it must choose whether it gets to move, take an action, or take a Bonus Action; it gets only one of the three. Success: Half damage, and the target suffers no other effects.

Inventors use artifice, technology, and gadgetry to create magical effects. Using their devices, inventors can attack with fire and lightning, augment their natural capabilities, or create convincing illusions. Although the effects caused by their inventions are often similar to the spells of mages, the devices themselves usually seem foreign or incomprehensible even to experienced spellcasters. Inventors are constantly tinkering, and their workshops are cluttered with strange apparatus and halfassembled contraptions that represent their next breakthrough.

action.name: Shocking Invention
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 11}, each creature in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line. {@actSaveFail} 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Lightning damage.

Inventors use artifice, technology, and gadgetry to create magical effects. Inventors are constantly tinkering, and their workshops are cluttered with strange apparatus and halfassembled contraptions that represent their next breakthrough.

action.name: Shocking Invention
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 11}, each creature in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line. {@actSaveFail} 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Lightning damage.

Inventors are constantly tinkering, and their workshops are cluttered with strange apparatus and halfassembled contraptions that represent their next breakthrough.

trait.name: Marvelous Invention
entries: The inventor has created a wearable apparatus that grants an extraordinary benefit. It has one of the following items:

items.name: Jet Pack
items.entry: The inventor has a Fly speed of 60 feet (Hover).

items.name: Power Armor
items.entry: The inventor has a +5 bonus to AC.

items.name: Antimagic Matrix
items.entry: The inventor has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magical Devices
entries: The inventor has assembled up to five devices that it can use to create magical effects. Each device is an object no larger than Huge. Tiny devices can be wielded in one hand by the inventor or attached to a willing Construct. The inventor can control and create effects from devices within 300 feet.
Regardless of size, each device has 25 Hit Points, an AC of 18, and immunity to Poison and Psychic damage. The inventor can make a new device by spending one hour with a set of tools.

action.name: Synchronize Devices
entries: The inventor takes two actions, choosing from among the following: Lightning Lance, Concussive Wave, Flamethrower, Tractor Beams, Deterrent Field, Image Projection, and Remote Viewing.

action.name: Lightning Lance
entries: One of the inventor's Magical Devices fires lightning. {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 60-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line. {@actSaveFail} 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Lightning damage.

action.name: Concussive Wave
entries: One of the inventor's Magical Devices emits disruptive sound. {@actSave con} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 30-foot-long, 15-foot-wide Line. {@actSaveFail} 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Thunder damage, the target loses {@status Concentration|XPHB}, and on the target's next turn it must choose whether it gets to move, take an action, or take a Bonus Action; it gets only one of the three. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage, and the target suffers no other effects.

action.name: Flamethrower
entries: One of the inventor's Magical Devices spews flames. {@actSave dex} {@dc 17}, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. {@actSaveFail} The target is set on fire. While set on fire this way, the target takes 16 ({@damage 3d10}) Fire damage at the start of each of its turns until it or an adjacent creature uses an action to pat out the flame.

action.name: Tractor Beams
entries: One of the inventor's Magical Devices extends {@condition invisible} tethers of force. {@actSave str} {@dc 17}, each Huge or smaller creature the inventor chooses within 30 feet of the Magical Device. {@actSaveFail} The target is pulled in a straight line toward the device, ending in an unoccupied space as close to it as possible. A creature pulled by this effect is then held in place, unable to move away from the device or be moved away from it. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the save to pull itself free and regain the ability to move normally. The effect ends if the device is destroyed or if the inventor uses a Bonus Action to dismiss it. If a creature that was held aloft by the device is freed, the creature falls if it does not have a fixed object to grab onto.

action.name: Deterrent Field
entries: The inventor chooses two of its Magical Devices that are no further than 100 feet from each other. The chosen devices project a 20 foot high, 5 foot thick wall of translucent, forceful energy that begins in the devices' spaces and spans the length between them. Ranged attacks can't pass through the wall, and for every 1 foot a creature moves through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. {@actSave con} {@dc 17}, each creature that enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn in the wall. {@actSaveFail} 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Force damage Success: Half damage.

The devices used to project the wall cannot be used for the inventor's other actions until it dismisses the wall as a Bonus Action. The wall also disappears if either of the devices projecting it are destroyed or moved more than 5 feet.

action.name: Image Projection
entries: The inventor chooses one of its Magical Devices and casts Major Image as if it were in that device's space rather than its own. The inventor uses Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}). Instead of the spell's normal duration, it lasts until the device is destroyed, the inventor uses a Bonus Action to dismiss it, or the inventor uses the same device to cast Major Image again.

action.name: Remote Viewing
entries: The inventor chooses one of its Magical Devices. The inventor can see and hear as if it were in the chosen device's space until it uses this action again or dismisses the effect as a Bonus Action. While the inventor is perceiving through its device, it is {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Deafened|XPHB} in regard to its own surroundings.

Although the effects caused by their inventions are often similar to the spells of mages, the devices themselves usually seem foreign or incomprehensible even to experienced spellcasters. Inventors are constantly tinkering, and their workshops are cluttered with strange apparatus and halfassembled contraptions that represent their next breakthrough.

trait.name: Magical Devices
entries: The inventor has assembled up to three devices that it can use to create magical effects. Each device is an object no larger than Huge. Tiny devices can be wielded in one hand by the inventor or attached to a willing Construct. The inventor can control and create effects from devices within 100 feet.
Regardless of size, each device has 10 Hit Points, an AC of 15, and immunity to Poison and Psychic damage. The inventor can make a new device by spending one hour with a set of tools.

action.name: Lightning Lance
entries: One of the inventor's Magical Devices fires lightning. Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line. Failure: 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Lightning damage.

action.name: Concussive Pulse
entries: One of the inventor's Magical Devices emits disruptive sound. Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 15-foot Cone. Failure: 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Thunder damage, the target loses Concentration, and on the target's next turn it must choose whether it gets to move, take an action, or take a Bonus Action; it gets only one of the three. Success: Half damage, and the target suffers no other effects.

Inventors use artifice, technology, and gadgetry to create magical effects. Using their devices, inventors can attack with fire and lightning, augment their natural capabilities, or create convincing illusions. Although the effects caused by their inventions are often similar to the spells of mages, the devices themselves usually seem foreign or incomprehensible even to experienced spellcasters. Inventors are constantly tinkering, and their workshops are cluttered with strange apparatus and halfassembled contraptions that represent their next breakthrough.

trait.name: Marvelous Invention
entries: The inventor has created a wearable apparatus that grants an extraordinary benefit. It has one of the following items:

items.name: Jet Pack
items.entry: The inventor has a Fly speed of 60 feet (Hover).

items.name: Power Armor
items.entry: The inventor has a +5 bonus to AC.

items.name: Antimagic Matrix
items.entry: The inventor has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magical Devices
entries: The inventor has assembled up to five devices that it can use to create magical effects. Each device is an object no larger than Huge. Tiny devices can be wielded in one hand by the inventor or attached to a willing Construct. The inventor can control and create effects from devices within 300 feet.
Regardless of size, each device has 40 Hit Points, an AC of 20, and immunity to Poison and Psychic damage. The inventor can make a new device by spending one hour with a set of tools.

action.name: Synchronize Devices
entries: The inventor takes two actions, choosing from among the following: Lightning Lance, Concussive Wave, Flamethrower, Tractor Beams, Deterrent Field, Image Projection, and Remote Viewing.

action.name: Lightning Lance
entries: One of the inventor's Magical Devices fires lightning. {@actSave dex} {@dc 20}, each creature in a 100-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line. {@actSaveFail} 38 ({@damage 11d6}) Lightning damage.

action.name: Concussive Wave
entries: One of the inventor's Magical Devices emits disruptive sound. {@actSave con} {@dc 20}, each creature in a 60-foot-long, 15-foot-wide Line. {@actSaveFail} 22 ({@damage 5d8}) Thunder damage, the target loses {@status Concentration|XPHB}, and on the target's next turn it must choose whether it gets to move, take an action, or take a Bonus Action; it gets only one of the three. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage, and the target suffers no other effects.

action.name: Flamethrower
entries: One of the inventor's Magical Devices spews flames. {@actSave dex} {@dc 20}, each creature in a 60-foot Cone. {@actSaveFail} The target is set on fire. While set on fire this way, the target takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) Fire damage at the start of each of its turns until it or an adjacent creature uses an action to pat out the flame.

action.name: Tractor Beams
entries: One of the inventor's Magical Devices extends {@condition invisible} tethers of force. {@actSave str} {@dc 20}, each Huge or smaller creature the inventor chooses within 60 feet of the Magical Device. {@actSaveFail} The target is pulled in a straight line toward the device, ending in an unoccupied space as close to it as possible. A creature pulled by this effect is then held in place, unable to move away from the device or be moved away from it. At the end of each of its turns, the target can repeat the save to pull itself free and regain the ability to move normally. The effect ends if the device is destroyed or if the inventor uses a Bonus Action to dismiss it. If a creature that was held aloft by the device is freed, the creature falls if it does not have a fixed object to grab onto.

action.name: Deterrent Field
entries: The inventor chooses two of its Magical Devices that are no further than 100 feet from each other. The chosen devices project a 20 foot high, 5 foot thick wall of translucent, forceful energy that begins in the devices' spaces and spans the length between them. Ranged attacks can't pass through the wall, and for every 1 foot a creature moves through the wall, it must spend 4 feet of movement. {@actSave con} {@dc 20}, each creature that enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn in the wall. {@actSaveFail} 27 ({@damage 6d8}) Force damage Success: Half damage.

The devices used to project the wall cannot be used for the inventor's other actions until it dismisses the wall as a Bonus Action. The wall also disappears if either of the devices projecting it are destroyed or moved more than 5 feet.

action.name: Image Projection
entries: The inventor chooses one of its Magical Devices and casts Major Image as if it were in that device's space rather than its own. The inventor uses Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}). Instead of the spell's normal duration, it lasts until the device is destroyed, the inventor uses a Bonus Action to dismiss it, or the inventor uses the same device to cast Major Image again.

action.name: Remote Viewing
entries: The inventor chooses one of its Magical Devices. The inventor can see and hear as if it were in the chosen device's space until it uses this action again or dismisses the effect as a Bonus Action. While the inventor is perceiving through its device, it is {@condition Blinded|XPHB} and {@condition Deafened|XPHB} in regard to its own surroundings.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight can use Issue Challenge if it is not currently challenging a creature. It then makes two Longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) Slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) Slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +2} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Issue Challenge
entries: The knight targets one creature it can see within 60 feet and challenges the target to single combat. Until the challenge ends, the knight and the target have Disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than each other. At the start of each of the target's turns, it can make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw to ignore the effect on itself until the start of its next turn. The target automatically succeeds on the save if it is more than 60 feet from the knight or if its Intelligence is 3 or lower.

The challenge ends if either the target or the knight is reduced to 0 HP, or the knight uses an action to formally dismiss the challenge. The knight cannot use this ability again until the challenge ends.

Knights are honorable warriors committed to serving an ideal or institution. Not all knights are good, but even those who stray toward evil follow a code of conduct. Knights are known for possessing equipment superior to that of common infantry; they wield finely smithed blades and masterwork armor, oftentimes astride well-trained warhorses. Knights-in-training, called squires, usually have the patronage of another knight or noble who ensures that they are adequately equipped and comport themselves with honor. All knights—new or veteran—are expected to live up to the demands of their institutions and earn the training and equipment they bear. Thus, every knight is prepared to ride fearlessly into peril and face any foe with bravery.

action.name: Imperious Challenge
entries: The knight targets one creature it can see within 30  can see within 100 feet and uses supernatural authority to challenge the target to single combat. Until the challenge ends, the knight and the target have Disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures other than each other, and other creatures have Advantage on saving throws that the knight or the target force them to make.

The challenge magically prevents interference, and attacks made by other creatures against the knight or the target have Disadvantage. In addition, the knight and the target have Advantage on saving throws against the spells and abilities of creatures other than each other.

The effects of the challenge are suppressed as long as the knight and the target are more than 100 feet from one another, and the challenge ends if either the target or the knight is reduced to 0 HP, or the knight uses an action to formally dismiss the challenge. The knight cannot use this ability again until the challenge ends.

bonus.name: Fasten Shield
entries: The knight Dons or Doffs its shield.

reaction.name: Interpose Shield (While Wielding a Shield)
entries: {@actTrigger} The knight is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage. The knight must be wielding a shield to use this ability. {@actResponse} The knight takes no damage if it succeeds on the save and only half damage if it fails.

reaction.name: Follow Through (While Wielding a Longsword in Two Hands)
entries: {@actTrigger} The knight would miss with a Longsword attack. {@actResponse} The knight rerolls the attack roll, potentially causing the attack to hit.

Knights are honorable warriors committed to serving an ideal or institution. Not all knights are good, but even those who stray toward evil follow a code of conduct. Knights are known for possessing equipment superior to that of common infantry; they wield finely smithed blades and masterwork armor, oftentimes astride well-trained warhorses. Knights-in-training, called squires, usually have the patronage of another knight or noble who ensures that they are adequately equipped and comport themselves with honor. All knights—new or veteran—are expected to live up to the demands of their institutions and earn the training and equipment they bear. Thus, every knight is prepared to ride fearlessly into peril and face any foe with bravery.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lawkeeper casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

action.name: Truncheon
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +2} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Halt (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The lawkeeper uses magical force to bind a creature. {@actSave str} {@dc 11}, one creature the lawkeeper can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the end of the lawkeeper's next turn.

Keeping the peace in a world of supernatural abilities sometimes requires its own kind of magic. The lawkeeper specializes in such magic, detaining foes and frustrating enemy spellcasters. Unlike bookish wizards, lawkeepers are well-armored and hardy enough to stand on the front lines. They are also keen-minded, adept at exposing illegal activities and discerning criminal intent. Lawkeepers are often requested by institutions when the goal is to apprehend rather than kill, or in support of mundane warriors against the extraordinary abilities possessed by many adventurers.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lawkeeper casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

trait.name: Investigate Arcana
entries: The lawkeeper can sense whether magic has been present within 30 feet of its current location any time in the last 24 hours. If the lawkeeper senses magic this way, it can take the Study action to discern its precise location, the magic's exact effect, or the type and any sub-types of the creature that caused it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lawkeeper makes two Justiciar's Baton attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Detain or Spellcasting, if available.

action.name: Justiciar's Baton
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) Bludgeoning damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) Force damage.

action.name: Forcebolt Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) Piercing damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) Force damage. If this attack reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the lawkeeper can choose for the target to become Stable.

action.name: Detain {@recharge 4}
entries: The lawkeeper uses magical force to bind a creature. {@actSave str} {@dc 16}, one creature the lawkeeper can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} and {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} conditions for 1 minute or until the lawkeeper's {@status Concentration|XPHB} is broken (as if {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell). A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Counterspell (2/Day)
entries: The Lawkeeper casts Counterspell in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability in Spellcasting.

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entries: The Lawkeeper casts Counterspell in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability in Spellcasting.

Keeping the peace in a world of supernatural abilities sometimes requires its own kind of magic. The lawkeeper specializes in such magic, detaining foes and frustrating enemy spellcasters. Unlike bookish wizards, lawkeepers are well-armored and hardy enough to stand on the front lines. They are also keen-minded, adept at exposing illegal activities and discerning criminal intent. Lawkeepers are often requested by institutions when the goal is to apprehend rather than kill, or in support of mundane warriors against the extraordinary abilities possessed by many adventurers.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lawkeeper casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 19}):

trait.name: Investigate Arcana
entries: The lawkeeper can sense whether magic has been present within 30 feet of its current location any time in the last 24 hours. If the lawkeeper senses magic this way, it can take the Study action to discern its precise location, the magic's exact effect, or the type and any sub-types of the creature that caused it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The lawkeeper makes two Justiciar's Baton attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Detain or Spellcasting, if available.

action.name: Justiciar's Baton
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 11}, reach 5 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage plus 31 ({@damage 9d6}) Force damage.

action.name: Forcebolt Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +7} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) Piercing damage plus 31 ({@damage 9d6}) Force damage. If this attack reduces the target to 0 Hit Points, the lawkeeper can choose for the target to become Stable.

action.name: Detain {@recharge 4}
entries: The lawkeeper uses magical force to bind a creature. {@actSave str} {@dc 19}, one creature the lawkeeper can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} and {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} conditions for 1 minute or until the lawkeeper's {@status Concentration|XPHB} is broken (as if {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell). A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Total Lockdown (1/Day)
entries: The lawkeeper causes arcane bonds to reach up in a 30-foot-radius, 100-foot-high Cylinder centered on a point on the ground within 120 feet. {@actSave str} {@dc 19}, any creature that enters the Cylinder for the first time on that creature's turn, or any creature that starts its turn in the Cylinder. {@actSaveFail} 44 ({@damage 8d10}) Force damage, and the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn. While {@condition Restrained|XPHB} in this way, creatures are unable to teleport and are pulled safely to the ground if they are flying. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage, and the target is not {@condition Restrained|XPHB}.

If the damage from this ability reduces a creature to 0 Hit Points, it has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition and is Stable. When the lawkeeper uses this ability, it can designate any number of creatures to be unaffected by the magic and able to act freely within the lockdown.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mage makes two Elemental Bolt attacks.

action.name: Elemental Bolt
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 4}, reach 5 f t. or range 120 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (mage's choice).

reaction.name: Shield (2/Day)
entries: The mage casts Shield in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability in Spellcasting.

Mages are the quintessential wielders of magic. Their spells reshape reality, defy the laws of nature, and make the impossible commonplace. Some mages obtain their abilities through diligent study, others through talents inherited from supernatural ancestors, and still others through deals with powerful entities. There is extraordinary variation among mages' areas of expertise and strength in magic. While some mages can only manage a handful of spells for practical use, others can call upon magic capable of leveling a city.

action.name: Storm of the Six Stars (Recharge after a Long Rest)
entries: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Saving Throw: DC 19, each creature of the mage's choice within 120 feet. Failure: 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Force damage for each failed saving throw. The target then suffers a different effect for each failed saving throw—

items.name: Strength:
items.entry: If the target's speed is greater than 10 feet, it is reduced to 10 feet for 1 hour. It can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this part of the effect on a success.

items.name: Dexterity:
items.entry: The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 hour. It can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this part of the effect on a success.

items.name: Constitution:
items.entry: Other creatures have Advantage on attack rolls against the target for 1 hour. It can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this part of the effect on a success.

items.name: Intelligence:
items.entry: The target cannot concentrate on spells, and cannot cast spells using spell slots of of level 3 or higher. This effect lasts for 1 hour. The target can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this part of the effect on a success.

items.name: Wisdom:
items.entry: Other creatures have Advantage on Saving Throws against the target's spells and abilities. This effect lasts for 1 hour. The target can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this part of the effect on a success.

items.name: Charisma:
items.entry: Any spells or spell effects affecting the target are dispelled. This effect does not dispel the mage's spells or spell effects.

headerEntries: The mage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}):

trait.name: Focused
entries: The mage has Advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain {@status Concentration|XPHB} on a spell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mage makes three Elemental Bolt attacks, or it makes one Elemental Bolt attack and uses Spellcasting.

action.name: Elemental Bolt
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 12}, reach 5 f t. or range 120 ft. {@h}49 ({@damage 9d10}) Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (mage's choice).

action.name: Elemental Blast {@recharge 4}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 20}, each creature in a 20-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point the mage can see within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} 52 ({@damage 15d6}) Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (mage's choice). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

action.name: Storm of the Six Stars (Recharge after a Long Rest)
entries: Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, Intelligence, Wisdom, and {@actSave cha} {@dc 19}, each creature of the mage's choice within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Force damage for each failed saving throw. The target then suffers a different effect for each failed saving throw—

items.name: Strength:
items.entry: If the target's speed is greater than 10 feet, it is reduced to 10 feet for 1 hour. It can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this part of the effect on a success.

items.name: Dexterity:
items.entry: The target has Disadvantage on attack rolls for 1 hour. It can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this part of the effect on a success.

items.name: Constitution:
items.entry: Other creatures have Advantage on attack rolls against the target for 1 hour. It can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this part of the effect on a success.

items.name: Intelligence:
items.entry: The target cannot concentrate on spells, and cannot cast spells using spell slots of of level 3 or higher. This effect lasts for 1 hour. The target can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this part of the effect on a success.

items.name: Wisdom:
items.entry: Other creatures have Advantage on Saving Throws against the target's spells and abilities. This effect lasts for 1 hour. The target can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending this part of the effect on a success.

items.name: Charisma:
items.entry: Any spells or spell effects affecting the target are dispelled. This effect does not dispel the mage's spells or spell effects.

reaction.name: Shield (3/Day)
entries: The mage casts Shield in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability in Spellcasting.

reaction.name: Counterspell (3/Day)
entries: The mage casts Counterspell in response to that spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability in Spellcasting.

Mages are the quintessential wielders of magic. Their spells reshape reality, defy the laws of nature, and make the impossible commonplace. Some mages obtain their abilities through diligent study, others through talents inherited from supernatural ancestors, and still others through deals with powerful entities. There is extraordinary variation among mages' areas of expertise and strength in magic. While some mages can only manage a handful of spells for practical use, others can call upon magic capable of leveling a city.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The martial artist makes two Unarmed Strike or Dart attacks in any combination.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Piercing damage.

bonus.name: Martial Technique (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Immediately after the martial artist hits a creature with an Unarmed Strike, it chooses one of the following:

items: The creature cannot take Reactions until the end of its next turn. In addition, on its next turn, it must choose whether it gets to move, take an action, or take a Bonus Action (it gets only one of the three).
The creature is pushed up to 15 feet away and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

bonus.name: Refocus
entries: The martial artist automatically recharges Martial Technique.

Martial Artists are warriors who train their bodies to be as dangerous as any weapon forged of crude steel. By cultivating the connection between their body and spirit, they tap into an inner source of power. With it, they can perform extraordinary feats of athleticism, make unarmed strikes with incredible speed and strength, and even disrupt the flow of energy in their opponents' bodies. They are nimble and fluid in combat, and many foes have difficulty landing even a single blow against their agile fighting style. Many martial artists train themselves for more than just combat, and follow a dedicated form of spirituality where their combat arts are viewed as one expression of a greater way of life.

action.name: Combination Attack
entries: The martial artist makes one Unarmed Strike. If the attack hits, the monk makes another Unarmed Strike against the same target.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage.

By cultivating the connection between their body and spirit, they tap into an inner source of power. With it, they can perform extraordinary feats of athleticism, make unarmed strikes with incredible speed and strength, and even disrupt the flow of energy in their opponents' bodies. They are nimble and fluid in combat, and many foes have difficulty landing even a single blow against their agile fighting style. Many martial artists train themselves for more than just combat, and follow a dedicated form of spirituality where their combat arts are viewed as one expression of a greater way of life.

trait.name: Floating Step
entries: The martial artist can move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on its turn without falling during the move.

trait.name: Effortless Form
entries: The martial artist's fluid movement causes attack rolls against it to have Disadvantage. When the martial artist takes damage from an attack or has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition, this trait is disrupted until the martial artist spends an action to resume it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The martial artist makes three Unarmed Strike or Dart attacks in any combination.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +8} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) Piercing damage.

bonus.name: Master's Technique (Recharge5-6)
entries: Immediately after the martial artist hits a creature with an Unarmed Strike, it chooses one of the following:

items: The creature cannot take Reactions until the end of its next turn. In addition, on its next turn, it must choose whether it gets to move, take an action, or take a Bonus Action (it gets only one of the three).
The creature is pushed up to 15 feet away and has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.
The creature cannot cast spells other than cantrips until the end of its next turn.

bonus.name: Recenter
entries: The martial artist automatically recharges Master's Technique, and resumes Effortless Form if that trait has been disrupted.

Martial Artists are warriors who train their bodies to be as dangerous as any weapon forged of crude steel. By cultivating the connection between their body and spirit, they tap into an inner source of power. With it, they can perform extraordinary feats of athleticism, make unarmed strikes with incredible speed and strength, and even disrupt the flow of energy in their opponents' bodies. They are nimble and fluid in combat, and many foes have difficulty landing even a single blow against their agile fighting style. Many martial artists train themselves for more than just combat, and follow a dedicated form of spirituality where their combat arts are viewed as one expression of a greater way of life.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The necromancer makes two Drain Life attacks.

action.name: Drain Life
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d12}) Necrotic damage, and the necromancer regains Hit Points equal to half the damage dealt.

Necromancers are spellcasters who call on the power of death itself. Their spells weaken muscles, decay flesh, and sap the warmth of the living. Necromancers understand the connection between life and death, and use it to animate undead servants to steal vitality from their victims. This power over death is typically seen as sinister or taboo, and necromancers evoke dread where their presence is discovered. Only the bravest souls confront necromancers, knowing what awaits them if they fail: the end of their life, and the beginning of their servitude.

entries: The necromancer magically summons 6 Skeletal Minions or Spirit Minions, which appear in unoccupied spaces within 10 feet. They last for 1 minute, until the necromancer dies, or until the necromancer uses this ability again.

entries: Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17, one creature within 60 feet the necromancer can see. Failure: The target is cursed for 1 hour. While cursed this way, the target cannot regain Hit Points. spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The performer casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

action.name: Confound
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 12}, one creature the performer can see within 60 feet. The target must be able to see or hear the performer. {@actSaveFail} 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has Disadvantage on {@dice D20} Tests until the end of the performer's next turn. If the performer wishes, it can choose to deal no damage with this action.

bonus.name: Chime In (3/Day)
entries: The performer targets a creature it can see within 30 feet. That creature has Advantage on {@dice D20} Tests until the start of the performer's next turn. A creature must be able to see or hear the performer to be affected by this ability.

Performers' magic comes from art itself, carried on beautiful melodies or silvered words. They have the power to inspire or dishearten, and can turn the tide of conversation as well as battle. Most performers are also well versed in history and myth, and they draw on this knowledge to dispense wisdom or weave spells. Rather than face an enemy head-on, they prefer to work through enchantment and illusion, making unwitting allies of former foes.

action.name: Otherworldly Performance (1/Day)
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 18}, each creature of the performer's choice within 60 feet. Creatures {@condition Charmed|XPHB} by the performer automatically fail the saving throw. {@actSaveFail} The target is magically teleported to a demiplane. The demiplane is a 50-foot-radius, 50-foot-high Cylinder filled with illusory terrain of the performer's choosing. The terrain is generally traversable and not directly harmful to creatures in the demiplane, but may be fantastical or otherwise confusing.

An illusory manifestation of the performer waits in the demiplane. spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

action.name: Punishing Bolt
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. For 1 minute, the target takes 8 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage whenever it attacks the priest or one of the priest's allies or forces them to make a saving throw. The target only takes this damage once per turn. The target can make a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 12}) at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Baneful Prayer (1/Day)
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 12}, any number of creatures the priest can see within 60

feet. {@actSaveFail} The target is cursed for 1 minute or until the priest's {@status Concentration|XPHB} ends (as if {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell). Whenever a cursed target makes an attack roll or saving throw, the target must roll a {@dice d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or save.

Not all divine magic is turned to healing and service. Priests of Darkness are followers of gods and otherworldly beings that have a more sinister nature. Their magic debilitates and corrupts, making easy victims of those who oppose them. Not all priests of Darkness are evil, but they and the factions they represent are often oriented toward gaining power at the expense of others. Priests of Darkness usually work with allies, whether like-minded co-conspirators, subordinates cowed into submission, or unwitting members of an otherwise judicious church.

action.name: Ritual Knife
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 3}, reach 5 ft. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) Piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Vessel of Divinity (1/Day)
entries: The priest touches a willing creature and imbues it with divine power from the upper or lower planes. The creature gains 50 temporary Hit Points, and the following benefits:

items: If the creature's AC is less than 21, it becomes 21.
The creature's attacks deal an extra 19 ({@dice 3d12}) Radiant (upper planes) or Necrotic (lower planes) damage.
The creature has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
If any of the creature's movement speeds are less than 120 feet, they become 120 feet, and the creature gains a Fly speed of 120 feet.

entries: The transformation ends after 1 minute, or if the creature is reduced to 0 Hit Points. After the transformation ends, the creature gains three {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels and cannot be affected by this ability again for one week.
