headerEntries: The priest casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 20}):

2e: {@spell cure wounds|XPHB} (level 6 version, target regains 12d8 + 5 Hit  Points)

trait.name: Unwavering Supplicants
entries: Allies of the priest within 30 feet cannot have the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} or {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions. When an ally within 30 feet takes damage that reduces it to 0 Hit Points, the ally can use its Reaction to make an attack and then take the damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The priest makes two Punishing Bolt attacks.

action.name: Punishing Bolt
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 12}, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. {@h}33 ({@damage 6d10}) necrotic damage. For 1 minute, the target takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) necrotic damage whenever it attacks the priest or one of the priest's allies or forces them to make a saving throw. The target only takes this damage once per turn. The target can make a Wisdom saving throw ({@dc 19}) at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Baneful Litany (3/Day)
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 20}, any number of creatures the priest can see within 60

feet. {@actSaveFail} The target is cursed for 1 minute or until the priest's {@status Concentration|XPHB} ends (as if {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell). Whenever a cursed target makes an attack roll or saving throw, the target must roll a {@dice d6} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or save.

action.name: Vessel of Divinity (1/Day)
entries: The priest touches a willing creature and imbues it with divine power from the upper or lower planes. The creature gains 100 temporary Hit Points, and the following benefits:

items: If the creature's AC is less than 23, it becomes 23.
The creature's attacks deal an extra 19 ({@dice 3d12}) Radiant (upper planes) or Necrotic (lower planes) damage.
The creature has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
If any of the creature's movement speeds are less than 120 feet, they become 120 feet, and the creature gains a Fly speed of 120 feet.

entries: The transformation ends after 1 minute, or if the creature is reduced to 0 Hit Points. After the transformation ends, the creature gains three {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels and cannot be affected by this ability again for one week.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

action.name: Censuring Light
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 4}, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) Radiant damage, and every foot of movement the target makes toward the priest costs 1 extra foot until the end of the priest's next turn.

bonus.name: Mend Wounds (2/Day)
entries: The priest or one creature of its choice within 30 feet regains 11 ({@dice 2d8 + 2}) Hit Points.

With dozens of gods across a multitude of pantheons, divine magic is ubiquitous in the realms of fantasy. Priests of Light are devotees of faiths associated with life, healing, and acts of service. They are as likely to be encountered as allies as they are to be enemies, and many heroes seek them out for aid. Priests of Light focus more on bolstering their allies than bringing ruin to their enemies, and they can keep those allies fighting long after others would have fallen.

action.name: Godly Intervention (1/Week)
entries: The priest calls directly on the power of the divine to perform a miracle. This may include calling forth a natural disaster, parting a sea, healing the wounded, or smiting all those who trespass against them. As part of the miracle, the priest can affect any number of creatures or objects within a 5 mile radius. If the effect restores Hit Points or causes damage, the priest can divide 200 points between the damage dealt or Hit Points restored. A creature dealt damage this way must make a {@dc 20} Charisma Saving Throw. On a success, it takes half as much damage instead.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shaman casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

action.name: Grasping Earth
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 12}, one creature on the ground within 60 feet that the shaman can see. {@actSaveFail} The target takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Bludgeoning damage and its Speed is reduced to 0 until the end of the shaman's next turn.

bonus.name: Shapechange (2/Day)
entries: The shaman magically transforms into a Beast. The shaman chooses whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by its new form. The shaman reverts to its true form if it dies or has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition. The shaman can also revert to its true form using a Bonus Action.
While in this form the shaman's stat block is replaced by the Beast Form stat block. When the shaman changes between forms, its current Hit Points remain the same.

Shamans call upon the primal magic of the natural world, harnessing the strength of the wilderness to serve their allies and directing the unbridled fury of the elements against their foes. They often take on the forms of animals from the lands they inhabit and are not afraid to wield those forms in defense of their homes. The way different shamans use their druidic magic is as varied as the seasons, and a shaman is as likely to be a spiritual counselor as they are a dangerous witch or an urban environmentalist.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The shaman casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 11}):

action.name: Grasping Earth
entries: Strength Saving Throw: DC 11, one creature on the ground within 60 feet that the shaman can see. Failure: The target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Bludgeoning damage and its Speed is reduced to 0 until the end of the shaman's next turn.

trait.name: Path of the Wilds
entries: The shaman and its allies within 60 feet are unaffected by difficult terrain caused by plants, rocks, or other natural features, whether or not they are magical. They are also immune to any damage caused by moving through these features.

entries: The shaman magically animates up to two natural features within 60 feet, such as a patch of earth, a tree, a waterfall, or a hanging vine. bonus.name: Shapechange (2/Day)
entries: The shaman magically transforms into a Beast. The shaman chooses whether its equipment falls to the ground, melds with its new form, or is worn by its new form. trait.name: Infantry Movement
entries: The soldier's allies do not provoke Opportunity Attacks from hostile creatures when moving into or out of the soldier's space.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The soldier makes two Longspear attacks.

action.name: Longspear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or 10ft. on the soldier's turn. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shield Wall
entries: Until the start of its next turn, the soldier and its allies within 5 feet have Three-Quarters Cover. Attacks ignore the cover if the space they originate from is closer to their target than to the soldier.

Soldiers are disciplined fighters, trained to move in formation and confront enemies using tactics and teamwork. They are most effective in groups, fighting alongside fellow soldiers or under the command of superior officers. Some soldiers fight for great causes, others for coin, and still others fight because they have been pressed into service, but for all soldiers war is a way of life. Though many fall in their first battle, those who survive become hardened to the horrors of the battlefield and learn to push their bodies past the limits of ordinary folk.

bonus.name: Coordinated Strike
entries: Immediately after the soldier hits a target with a melee attack, it chooses an ally. If that ally can see or hear the soldier, it can make a melee attack against the same target as a Reaction.

Soldiers are disciplined fighters, trained to move in formation and confront enemies using tactics and teamwork. They are most effective in groups, fighting alongside fellow soldiers or under the command of superior officers. Some soldiers fight for great causes, others for coin, and still others fight because they have been pressed into service, but for all soldiers war is a way of life. Though many fall in their first battle, those who survive become hardened to the horrors of the battlefield and learn to push their bodies past the limits of ordinary folk.

trait.name: Infantry Movement
entries: The soldier's allies do not provoke Opportunity Attacks from hostile creatures when moving into or out of the soldier's space.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The soldier makes two Longspear attacks.

action.name: Longspear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or 10ft. on the soldier's turn. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Javelin
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shield Wall
entries: Until the start of its next turn, the soldier and its allies within 5 feet have Three-Quarters Cover. Attacks ignore the cover if the space they originate from is closer to their target than to the soldier.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spellsword casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 12}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spellsword makes two Elemental Blade attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting, if available.

action.name: Elemental Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) Slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (spellsword's choice).

action.name: War Arcana {@recharge 4}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 12}, each creature in a 15-foot Cone or a 30-foot-long, 5-
foot-wide Line (spellsword's choice). {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (spellsword's choice). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

reaction.name: Sorcerous Deflection
entries: {@actTrigger} The spellsword is hit by an attack roll or fails a Saving Throw against a spell. Re-sponse: The spellsword gains a +2 bonus to AC and to saving throws against spells until the end of the turn, including against the triggering attack or spell.

Spellswords fuse magic and melee into a deadly art. They do not distinguish between the mystical and the material, using their blade to parry spells and slice enchantments into ribbons. Attaining this level of command over steel and spell takes incredible skill: Most spellswords are either members of races long-lived enough to master both arts individually, or people who have undergone unusual or experimental training. Their skills are as formidable as they are rare, and a spellsword's presence on the battlefield is always worthy of respect.

foot-wide Line (spellsword's choice). {@actSaveFail} 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (spellsword's choice). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

bonus.name: Misty Step (2/Day)
entries: The spellsword casts Misty Step.

reaction.name: Sorcerous Deflection
entries: {@actTrigger} The spellsword is hit by an attack roll or fails a Saving Throw against a spell. Re-sponse: The spellsword gains a +3 bonus to AC and to saving throws against spells until the end of the turn, including against the triggering attack or spell.

Spellswords fuse magic and melee into a deadly art. They do not distinguish between the mystical and the material, using their blade to parry spells and slice enchantments into ribbons. Attaining this level of command over steel and spell takes incredible skill: Most spellswords are either members of races long-lived enough to master both arts individually, or people who have undergone unusual or experimental training. Their skills are as formidable as they are rare, and a spellsword's presence on the battlefield is always worthy of respect.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The spellsword casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spellsword makes three attacks, using Elemental Blade or Dispelling Cut in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting or War Arcana, if available.

action.name: Elemental Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +8} to hit, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) Slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (spellsword's choice).

action.name: Dispelling Cut
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) Slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Force damage, and the highest level spell on the target ends.

action.name: War Arcana {@recharge 4}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 16}, each creature in a 30-foot Cone or a 100-foot-long, 5-
foot-wide Line (spellsword's choice). {@actSaveFail} 28 ({@damage 8d6}) Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage (spellsword's choice). {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

entries: The spellsword casts Misty Step.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The templar casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 11}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The templar makes two Longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) Slashing damage.

bonus.name: Radiant Smite (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: Immediately after the templar hits a target with an attack—{@actSave cha} {@dc 11}, the target. {@actSaveFail} The target sheds Bright Light in a 5-foot-radius until the end
of the templar's next turn. Creatures that can see the illumination have Advantage on attack rolls against the target.

Templars are bound by oath to champion a spiritual ideal. Their devotion to this ideal empowers them: A templar can cast spells, and their attacks are strengthened by divine power. Some templars dedicate themselves to religious convictions, such as service to a god or church, but many templars commit themselves to an abstract idea, such as "justice," "vengeance," or "peace." The very presence of a templar bolsters allies, and if those allies fall, the templar can heal their injuries and ailments with a touch. Girded in stout armor and bearing a radiant sword, a templar is a beacon of hope to their friends and a harbinger of retribution to their enemies.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The templar casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

trait.name: Blessed Aura
entries: When the templar or one of its allies within a 10-foot Emanation originating from the templar makes a saving throw, it adds {@dice 1d6} to the roll.

trait.name: Inquisitor
entries: The templar knows when it hears a creature speak a lie.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The templar makes three Greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) Slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Radiant damage.

action.name: Purifying Touch (1/Day)
entries: The templar or one creature of its choice within 5 feet regains 100 Hit Points. In addition, all curses and poisons affecting the target are removed.

bonus.name: Smite
entries: Immediately after the templar hits a target with an attack—{@actSave cha} {@dc 15}, the target. {@actSaveFail} The target suffers one of the following effects of the templar's choice:

items: {@b Radiance.} The target sheds Bright Light in a 5-foot-radius until the end of the templar's next turn. Creatures that can see the illumination have Advantage on attack rolls against the target.

{@b Punishment.} The templar places an abjuration on the target that lasts for 1 minute. The abjured target takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Radiant damage when it deals damage to another creature for the first time on a turn. The abjured target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

monster.name: Thief (CR 1)
languages: Thieves' Cant plus any two languages

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) Piercing damage. The attack instead deals 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Piercing damage if the thief has Advantage on the attack roll or if the target is within 5 feet of one of the thief's allies.

action.name: Steal
entries: Wisdom (Perception) Check: {@dc 15}, a creature the thief can see within 5 feet. The target has Advantage on the check if it is fighting the thief. {@actSaveFail} The thief steals an object it can pick up with one hand that the target has in its possession but not in its grasp, without the target noticing the theft.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The thief takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

Whether in crowded streets, second-story windows, or trap-riddled tombs, thieves have no match when it comes to liberating property. They have an eye for value, know how to move unseen, and are quick-footed on the exit. Thieves generally prefer a quick getaway over an outright fight, but an angry mark who corners a thief might find they've bitten off more than they can chew.

monster.name: Thief (CR 1/2)
languages: Thieves' Cant plus any two languages

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Steal

Whether in crowded streets, second-story windows, or trap-riddled tombs, thieves have no match when it comes to liberating property. They have an eye for value, know how to move unseen, and are quick-footed on the exit. Thieves generally prefer a quick getaway over an outright fight, but an angry mark who corners a thief might find they've bitten off more than they can chew.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thug can use Blinding Debris, if available. It then makes two Mace attacks.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) Bludgeoning damage. On a Critical Hit, the target has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of the thug's next turn.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Blinding Debris (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: {@actSave dex} 12, one creature within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the end of the thug's next turn.

action.name: Take Hostage
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 12}, one Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 12}). While {@condition grappled}, the target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition, and whenever another creature misses the thug with an attack, that attack hits the target instead. The thug can only have one hostage at a time.

Thugs are scrappers, living or dying by the strength of their sword arm. Not all fighters have the benefit of diligent trainers or veteran mentors; thugs paid for their skills with blood in the dirt and scars on their hands. They come from many walks of life and can be found in all corners of the world, especially the corners where gold or glory can be found at the end of a length of cold steel. Thugs may not fight fancy, but they get the job done.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage. On a Critical Hit, the target has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition until the end of the thug's next turn.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +7} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}51 ({@damage 9d10 + 2}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Hit 'Em Where It Hurts {@recharge 4}
entries: Melee Attack Roll: {@hit 10}, reach 5 ft. Hit: 50 ({@damage 7d12 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target is wracked with excruciating pain until the end of the thug's next turn. The target has the Prone condition, and until the pain ends, it cannot stand up, cast or concentrate on spells, or make more than one attack during its turn.

action.name: Blinding Debris (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: {@actSave dex} 18, one creature within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Blinded|XPHB} condition until the end of the thug's next turn.

action.name: Strong-Arm
entries: Strength Saving Throw: DC 18, one Medium or smaller creature within 5 feet. Failure: The target has the Grappled condition (escape DC 18). While grappled, the target has the Restrained condition, attacks against the thug have disadvantage, and whenever another creature misses the thug with an attack, that attack hits the target instead. The thug can only have one creature Grappled this way at a time.

Thugs are scrappers, living or dying by the strength of their sword arm. Not all fighters have the benefit of diligent trainers or veteran mentors; thugs paid for their skills with blood in the dirt and scars on their hands. They come from many walks of life and can be found in all corners of the world, especially the corners where gold or glory can be found at the end of a length of cold steel. Thugs may not fight fancy, but they get the job done.

trait.name: Shrug It Off
entries: The thug regains 20 Hit Points at the start of its turn. This trait ceases to function while the thug is Bloodied (120 HP or less).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thug can use Blinding Debris, if available. It then makes three Mace attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Strong-Arm.

action.name: Brutal Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage. On a Critical Hit, the target is {@condition Stunned|XPHB} until the end of the thug's next turn, and the thug chooses one of the target's ability scores and inflicts some form of terrible injury on the target. The target has Disadvantage on all {@dice D20} Tests that use the chosen ability score until it receives healing from a spell of 6th level or higher.
